variants.Description in input context: c.248G>A (p.G83D) - This variant causes a structural change in the protein, affecting its function.
A frameshift variant leading to premature termination of the BRCA1 protein.

Described Disease.Disease Name: Hereditary Myopathy & Increased Risk of Breast & Ovarian Cancer

Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using the HEK293 cell line.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression was reduced by 50% for the variant NM_001126112.3:c.248G>A.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% on day 7.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% on day 7.

Material used.Description: Genomic DNA extracted from blood sample of proband.

Readout description.Result Description: A frameshift variant detected through Sanger sequencing.

Basic positive control.Description: Control DNA amplified and sequenced to verify primer functionality.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Sequence trace with clean peaks corresponding to expected sequence.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Sequence trace with abnormal peaks or missing peaks.
